resources.string:
"Puzzle 15 is a sliding puzzle that consists of a frame of numbered square tiles in random order with one tile missing. 
 The puzzle was "invented" by Noyes Palmer Chapman, a postmaster in Canastota, New York. 
 The game became a craze in the U.S. in February 1880, Canada in March, Europe in April, but that craze had dissipated by July. Apparently, the puzzle was not introduced to Japan until 1889. 
 Bobby Fischer was an expert at solving the 15-Puzzle. He had been timed to be able to solve it within 25 seconds; Fischer demonstrated this on November 8, 1972, on The Tonight Show Starring Johnny"
"Place 4 on the right side of 2. \n Place 3 under 4"
"Make an empty space on the right side of 4"
"Place 8 on the right side of 6. \n Place 7 under 8"
"Make an empty space on the right side of 8"
"Move around the blocks 11, 12, and 15 to put them to their original places. \n If they don't go to their original places, do method 3 again by mixing only the last two"
